content.question: Which of the following developments in the interwar period most undermines Ortega y Gassetâ€™s claim that Europeans were moving away from established models of authority?

choices.label: The continued popularity of astrology and the occult among both the elite and the nonelite segments of the population
The discoveries of physicists such as Albert Einstein, Ernest Rutherford, and Niels Bohr, which provided a new framework for the understanding of the cosmos and the atom
The emergence of right-wing authoritarian regimes in Spain and Portugal, supported by traditional elites and the Catholic Church
The widespread disillusionment with European values associated with the Lost Generation

content.answer: The emergence of right-wing authoritarian regimes in Spain and Portugal, supported by traditional elites and the Catholic Church
